abstract: The chief executive of Toronto-Dominion Bank, W. Edmund Clark, said he did not plan to follow the lead of executives at the Goldman Sachs Group and forgo his annual bonus.
snippet: The chief executive of Toronto-Dominion Bank, W. Edmund Clark, said he did not plan to follow the lead of executives at the Goldman Sachs Group and forgo his annual bonus.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive of Toronto-Dominion Bank, W. Edmund Clark, said he did not plan to follow the lead of executives at the Goldman Sachs Group and forgo his annual bonus. Separately, the company said it had a trading loss of 350 million Canadian dollars ($273 million) in its investment banking and corporate businesses. The Toronto-based bank reported that profit in its fiscal fourth quarter missed analysts’ estimates after the company took a loss in its credit trading business. The bank will report complete results on Dec. 4.
